intro: Rinzia ericaea, commonly known as the heath rinzia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and summer seasons. Rinzia ericaea is often found in heathlands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
